intro: Phacelia beatleyae, commonly known as Beatley's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, ovate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
